triageFlags.title: Excessive Loan-to-Value (LTV) Ratio
triageFlags.description: The LTV ratio exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the proposal as the LTV ratio is non-compliant with policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the maximum LTV for Tier A applicants is 110%. The current LTV of 224.44% is significantly higher, indicating a high risk of financial overextension.

triageFlags.title: Excessive Debt-to-Income (DTI) Ratio
triageFlags.description: The DTI ratio exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the proposal as the DTI ratio is non-compliant with policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 45% for Tier A applicants. The current DTI of 55% indicates that the applicant's financial commitments are too high relative to their income, posing a significant risk.

content.reasoning: The applicant's LTV ratio of 224.44% significantly exceeds the maximum allowable threshold of 110% for their credit tier (Tier A). Additionally, the DTI ratio of 55% surpasses the maximum allowable threshold of 45% for Tier A applicants. These violations indicate a high risk of financial overextension, making the proposal non-compliant with underwriting policies.
